content: I am currently coding Neural Network models on Google Colab and the training sessions take quite a bit of time to run. Is there a way to set up an audio notification for when a cell has finished running? I already know that the Tab Icon changes color to indicate this - it's grey when busy and turns yellow when done - but I haven't found any information on how to set up audio notifications.

Certainly! You can set up audio notifications in Google Colab by using the `IPython.display.Audio` module to play a sound once a cell finishes running. Here's how you can do it:

1. First, you need to have an audio file that you want to play as a notification. You can either upload a local file to your Colab session or use a URL of an audio file.

2. Use the following code snippet to play the audio file once your cell execution is complete:

```python
from IPython.display import Audio, display
import time

# Function to play audio notification
def play_sound():
    sound_file = 'path/to/your/soundfile.mp3'  # Specify the path to your audio file
    display(Audio(filename=sound_file, autoplay=True))

# Example of a long-running task
def long_running_task():
    # Simulating a long task with sleep
    time.sleep(10)  # Replace this with your actual task code
    play_sound()

# Run the long-running task
long_running_task()
```

3. If you prefer to use a sound file from a URL, you can modify the `play_sound` function as follows:

```python
def play_sound():
    sound_url = 'https://example.com/soundfile.mp3'  # Replace with your sound file URL
    display(Audio(url=sound_url, autoplay=True))
```

This code will play the specified audio file once the long-running task (or any other code you place before `play_sound()`) is complete. Make sure your browser tab has permission to play audio for this to work correctly.

You can replace the `time.sleep(10)` with your actual neural network training code to be notified when the training is complete.
